arts.ttl: Jhon Duran sale claim emerges just three months after Aston Villa transfer
arts.sum: Al-Nassr sporting director Fernando Hierro has admitted that the Saudi Pro League club are investing in youth with a view to selling on those players for a profit in the future - and that extends to former Aston Villa forward Jhon Duran. Duran dismissed the idea that his move to Al-Nassr in the first place was motivated by money; the striker had only moved to Villa from Chicago Fire in January 2023 and was emerging as a crucial figure in Unai Emery's squad before his exit two years into his B6 stay.

arts.ttl: PSG's intentions at Aston Villa clear as Luis Enrique makes Villa Park prediction
arts.sum: Aston Villa will welcome PSG to Birmingham for the second leg of the Champions League quarter final next week Luis Enrique has reiterated that Paris Saint-Germain will be showing up at Aston Villa next Tuesday evening with the intention of winning the second leg - and he predicts that his talented Ligue 1 champions will have more space to hurt Villa on their own patch because of the scenario Villa find themselves in.

arts.ttl: 3/10, 4/10… – How French newspaper L’Equipe rated Aston Villa players
arts.sum: Aston Villa’s big away day in Paris didn’t go exactly how the club will have hoped for, although all hope isn’t lost ahead of the second leg of the Champions League tie. Unai Emery’s side even managed to take the lead via Morgan Rogers, but Luis Enrique’s slick PSG – fresh off the back of The post 3/10, 4/10… – How French newspaper L’Equipe rated Aston Villa players appeared first on Sport Witness.

arts.ttl: 'Strange': France's media deliver their Marcus Rashford verdict after watching Aston Villa forward vs PSG
arts.sum: Unai Emery made the bold decision to start Marcus Rashford instead of Ollie Watkins for Aston Villa away to Paris Saint-Germain in the Champions League....

arts.ttl: ‘Team that convinces him’ – Player prefers move to Liverpool after snubbing Aston Villa
arts.sum: In the first half of the season, several claims from Spain had stated Liverpool are looking at Sevilla’s Loïc Badé. The Reds didn’t make efforts to sign the centre-back in the winter market, who rejected Aston Villa in the same window. Vamos Mi Sevilla FC state the defender is on Liverpool’s agenda for the summer The post ‘Team that convinces him’ – Player prefers move to Liverpool after snubbing Aston Villa appeared first on Sport Witness.

arts.ttl: What Man Utd fans were saying about Marcus Rashford during PSG vs Aston Villa
arts.sum: What Man Utd fans were saying about Marcus Rashford during PSG vs Aston Villa The Aston Villa loanee was chosen to start the Champions League quarter-final first leg by Unai Emery and he was deployed as a lone striker.

arts.ttl: What Emery did in the dressing room and why Villa can still spring PSG surprise
arts.sum: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia then turned the game on its head early in the second half, before Nuno Mendes added a third in stoppage time to put PSG in a commanding position. Having scored two or more goals in each of their last five home games - and in 11 of their last 13 - Emery’s side will still believe they can pull off a shock at Villa Park.

arts.ttl: PSG's comeback against Villa shows desire for Champions League glory
arts.sum: Paris Saint-Germain achieved an important 3-1 first-leg quarterfinal win against Aston Villa, which allows them to really contend for the Champions League.

arts.ttl: “Villa wanted to keep the 2-1” – reaction from Vitinha, Nuno Mendes as PSG move closer to CL semis
arts.sum: Paris Saint-Germain 3-1 Aston Villa French champions Paris Saint-Germain are in the driving seat heading into the second leg of their Champions League quarter final, after beating Aston Villa in the French capital. Nuno Mendes scored what could be a crucial third goal in stoppage time, while Vitinha and Joao Neves also shone once again in midfield for Luis Enrique’s side, who impressed neutrals with a thrilling display. Villa took a surprise lead ten minutes before the break and it was a goal Mendes will wish to forget. Having earned so many plaudits for his performances against Liverpool in the previous round, Mendes was caught in possession near the halfway line and Villa, primed to rely on transitions by boss Unai Emery, broke in clinical fashion to provide Morgan Rodgers with a simple finish. PSG hit back quickly, levelling before the break through a stunning strike by the eye-catching Désiré Doué. The hosts provided much entertainment on the night, particularly through the movement of their creative players, and recent signing Khvicha Kvaratskhelia put PSG 2-1 up early in the second half with a thunderous finish. The slender lead of 2-1 would probably have satisfied Villa, who would have felt things could have been much worse given their struggles to contain the French side. However, in the second minute of added time Nuno Mendes got the third forward play reminiscent of an established striker: the former Sporting man dummied the ball to evade both defender Konsa and goalkeeper Martinez before slotting into the net with his right foot. Gonçalo Ramos was issued just seconds on the field as a substitute after the third goal, but Mendes was not the only Portuguese PSG player to shine. Once again Joao Neves’ energy and quality was notable, while compatriot Vitinha made a remarkable 152 passes on the night, racking up a pass completion rate of 97% to further demonstrate his status as one of the very best ball-playing midfielder in Europe. Reaction: Vitinha: “We played well, it's a deserved result. As usual, it's not over yet, there's a second match, we'll have to be ready, but it's a good victory. “Going behind? It's not the first time, we know it can happen, and we reacted well once again. That's the strength of this team; we have to take advantage of this momentum. It’s not over. The Champions League is fantastic. We'll be ready, we'll play a good match there. “This goal changes everything? It's always important. I don't know if it changes anything, but it's always important. We felt that Aston Villa wanted to keep the 2-1.” Nuno Mendes: "This third goal gives us more confidence. A two-goal lead is good, but we have to keep going. We still have one more game to play. Two goals, I think, is nothing. If they score first there, we'll have a hard time because they'll be at home. “The opener? The coach tells us every day that if we concede a goal, we have to keep going, that we always play the same game. We're strong with the ball, we have to defend with the ball, and we know that spaces will open up, and we try to find those spaces. Today we did it, we played a good game, so it's good." Should PSG progress to the last four, they will meet the winner of the tie between Real Madrid and Arsenal, which currently stands at 3-0 to the English side after a stunning victory in London on Tuesday. By @SeanGillen9

arts.ttl: 'We believe in Villa Park' - can Emery's men rescue tie?
arts.sum: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery says he "believes in Villa Park", but can the Premier League side really turn things around to reach the Champions League semi-finals?
